Title.evidence: Cost-Effectiveness of UDCA Prophylaxis in Preventing Symptomatic Gallstone Disease: A Randomised Controlled Trial

Trial_Design.evidence: Conducted as a multicentre, double-blind, randomised placebo-controlled superiority trial

Participants.evidence: patients scheduled for laparoscopic RYGB or sleeve gastrectomy

Intervention.evidence: randomised to receive 900 mg UDCA or placebo for 6 months

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to evaluate the cost-effectiveness and cost-utility of ursodeoxycholic acid (UDCA) prophylaxis for preventing symptomatic gallstone disease

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the incidence of symptomatic gallstone disease within 24 months

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using a computer-generated sequence with allocation concealment

Blinding.evidence: Patients, clinicians, and outcome assessors were blinded

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 985 patients were enrolled between January 2017 and October 2018

Number_Analysed.evidence: 705 analysed in the modified intention-to-treat analysis

Result_Outcome.evidence: UDCA prophylaxis significantly reduced the risk of symptomatic gallstone disease (relative risk 1.06, 95% CI 1.02 to 1.11; P = 0.002)

Harms.evidence: No significant adverse events were reported, with mild gastrointestinal side-effects occurring in 3% of the UDCA group and 1% of the placebo group
